| HistoryText             = The Brothers Four claim to have been created and taught their magical powers by the wizard posing as [[Maha Yogi (Earth-616)|Merlin]] for the purposes of seeking out and destroying [[Modred (Earth-616)|Modred the Mystic]]. Their numbers included the earth elemental [[Mud (Earth-616)|Mud]], the fire element known as [[Fire (Earth-616)|Fire]], the water element known as [[Hydro (Earth-616)|Hydro]], and the air element [[Aero (Earth-616)|Aero]]. They were placed in stasis within a chest that eventually ended up beneath British Parliament.{{r|Marvel Two-In-One #33}}<ref group="note">As revealed in {{cl|Avengers Annual #22}}, this was not the wizard [[Merlyn (Otherworld)|Merlin]], but the impostor also known as the [[Maha Yogi (Earth-616)|Maha Yogi]]. As revealed in {{cl|Marvel Chillers #1}}, the "Mad" Merlin sought to make Modred his apprentice. Instead, the young mystic fell under the influence of the demon [[Chthon (Earth-616)|Chthon]] and was placed in suspended animation until the [[Glossary:Modern Age|modern age]].</ref> The brothers were inadvertently freed by two thieves seeking to recover stolen [[National Socialist German Workers Party (Earth-616)|Nazi]] loot hidden in Parliment during [[World War II]].{{r|Marvel Two-In-One #32}} Materializing in a cavern below [[Stonehenge]] and began capturing tourists to drain them of the energies they needed to pull Modred back in time and return him to their master. Their arrival drew the visiting heroes [[Jessica Drew (Earth-616)|Spider-Woman]], the [[Fantastic Four (Earth-616)|Fantastic Four's]] [[Benjamin Grimm (Earth-616)|Thing]] and the Thing's girlfriend [[Alicia Masters (Earth-616)|Alicia Masters]]. The Thing and Spider-Woman battled the creatures until Modred -- sensing the elemental's arrival came. Modred then used his superior magics to turn each elemental against their opposite, the powers of one cancelling out the other, destroying the Four Brothers before they could complete their mission.{{r|Marvel Two-In-One #33}}
